etymology.description: 软(soft) + 件(item; piece) = software (soft/immaterial components).
etymology.interpretation: Coined as a calque of English “software” to contrast with 硬件, grouping programs and data as the ‘soft’ items of a computer system. Standard in Mainland China and Hong Kong; Taiwan more often uses 軟體.
etymology.simplification: 軟 was simplified to 软 in the PRC reform (車-series to 车), while 件 is unchanged; reduces stroke count and aligns with the hardware/software contrast.

examples.chinese: 我需要安装这款软件(我需要安裝這款軟件)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xūyào ānzhuāng zhè kuǎn ruǎnjiàn.
examples.english: I need to install this software.

examples.chinese: 这个应用软件可以提高工作效率(這個應用軟件可以提高工作效率)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège yìngyòng ruǎnjiàn kěyǐ tígāo gōngzuò xiàolǜ.
examples.english: This application software can improve work efficiency.

examples.chinese: 与硬件相比(與硬件相比)，软件更新更频繁(軟件更新更頻繁)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ yìngjiàn xiāngbǐ, ruǎnjiàn gēngxīn gèng pínfán.
examples.english: Compared to hardware, software updates more frequently.
